entries.title: Display Orientation
entries.description: Set screen orientation for Cinema mode.
entries.help: Choose portrait (vertical) or landscape (horizontal) based on how your display is mounted. This affects the overall layout and poster sizing.
entries.example: Portrait for wall-mounted TVs in vertical position

entries.title: Display Rotation
entries.help: Rotate the entire display by 0, 90, 180, or 270 degrees. Useful when your TV's physical mounting doesn't match the HDMI output direction.

entries.title: Poster Interval
entries.description: How long each poster stays on screen.
entries.help: Time in seconds before switching to the next poster. Shorter intervals create a livelier display, longer intervals let you appreciate each poster.

entries.title: Transition Effect
entries.help: Choose how posters transition. Options include fade (smooth dissolve), slide (movement), zoom, and more. 'None' switches instantly without animation.

entries.title: Transition Duration
entries.description: How fast the transition animation plays.
entries.help: Duration in milliseconds for the transition effect. Lower values = faster transitions. Only applies when a transition effect is selected.

entries.title: Background Mode
entries.help: Choose the background style. Solid uses a single color, blurred shows a soft version of the current poster behind it, gradient creates a smooth color fade.

entries.title: Background Color
entries.description: Background color when using solid mode.
entries.help: Pick any color for the background. Only visible when Background Mode is set to 'Solid'. Black is classic, but match your room's decor if you prefer.

entries.title: Poster Scaling
entries.description: How the poster fits the screen.
entries.help: Contain shows the full poster with possible letterboxing. Cover fills the screen but may crop edges. Fit scales to maximum size while keeping aspect ratio.

entries.title: Poster Position
entries.description: Where the poster appears on screen.
entries.help: Choose horizontal alignment: left, center, or right. Useful when you want to leave room for metadata on one side, or simply prefer off-center placement.

entries.title: Shuffle Posters
entries.help: When enabled, posters appear in random order instead of sequential. Great for variety. When disabled, posters cycle in the order received from your media source.

entries.title: Vignette Effect
entries.help: Adds subtle darkening around the screen edges, mimicking classic cinema projection. Creates focus on the center of the display. Choose intensity from subtle to strong, or disable completely.

entries.title: Background Blur
entries.help: When using blurred poster as background, this controls how much blur is applied. Higher values create a softer, more diffused background. Only visible when Background Mode is set to 'Blurred Poster'.

entries.title: Poster Style
entries.help: Choose how the poster is displayed. Options include flat (no effects), with drop shadow for depth, or framed with a decorative border. Shadow gives a floating appearance, frame adds a classic gallery look.

entries.title: Poster Overlay
entries.description: Add overlay effect on the poster.
entries.help: Applies a gradient or color overlay on top of the poster image. Useful for improving text readability when metadata is displayed over the poster. Choose from various gradient directions or solid overlays.

entries.title: Frame Color Mode
entries.description: Color of the poster frame border.
entries.help: When Poster Style includes a frame, this sets its color. 'Fixed' uses a single color you choose. 'Ton-sur-ton' automatically extracts the dominant color from each poster for a matching frame. Light and Dark variants adjust the extracted color's brightness.
entries.example: Use 'Ton-sur-ton Dark' for frames that complement each poster.

entries.title: Frame Width
entries.help: Sets the width of the decorative frame around the poster in pixels. Only visible when Poster Style is set to a framed option. Default is 8 pixels.

entries.title: Poster Animation
entries.description: How posters transition in and out.
entries.help: Choose the animation style when switching between posters. Options include fade (smooth dissolve), slide (posters move in/out), zoom, and various combinations. 'None' switches instantly without animation.

entries.title: Metadata Layout
entries.help: Choose the position and style of movie metadata (title, year, rating, etc.). Options include overlay on the poster, panel below, or hidden. Different layouts suit different display orientations and viewing distances.

entries.title: Metadata Opacity
entries.help: Controls how transparent the metadata panel or overlay appears. 100% is fully opaque, lower values let the poster show through. Useful for balancing readability with visual aesthetics.

entries.title: Show Year
entries.help: Shows the year the movie was released in the metadata section. Enable to help viewers identify when a movie was made.

entries.title: Show Runtime
entries.help: Shows how long the movie runs (e.g., '2h 15m') in the metadata section.

entries.title: Show Rating
entries.help: Shows the movie's rating (e.g., 8.5/10) in the metadata section. The rating source is determined by your Rating Source setting.

entries.title: Show Certification
entries.help: Shows the age/content certification (PG-13, R, etc.) in the metadata section. Useful for family viewing decisions.

entries.title: Show Genre
entries.help: Shows the movie's genre(s) like Action, Drama, Comedy in the metadata section.

entries.title: Show Director
entries.help: Shows who directed the movie in the metadata section.

entries.title: Show Studio Logo
entries.help: Shows the movie studio's logo (Warner Bros, Universal, etc.) in the metadata section when available.

entries.title: Show Resolution
entries.help: Shows the video quality (4K, 1080p, 720p) as a badge or icon. Indicates the quality of the file in your library.

entries.title: Show Audio Format
entries.help: Shows the audio codec (Dolby Atmos, DTS-HD, etc.) as a badge. Indicates the sound quality available in your file.

entries.title: Show HDR
entries.help: Shows if the video has HDR (HDR10, Dolby Vision, etc.) as a badge. Only displays when HDR metadata is present in your file.

entries.title: Show Aspect Ratio
entries.help: Shows the aspect ratio (2.39:1, 16:9, etc.) as a badge. Useful for cinephiles who care about original aspect ratios.

entries.title: Specs Style
entries.help: Choose how resolution, audio, and HDR info appear. Options include text labels, icon badges, or compact icons only.

entries.title: Specs Icon Set
entries.help: Choose which icon set to use for technical specification badges. Different sets offer various visual styles.

entries.title: Rating Badge
entries.description: Show a prominent rating badge on the poster.
entries.help: Displays a rating score badge (IMDB, Rotten Tomatoes, etc.) overlaid on the poster. Position and source are configurable.

entries.title: Rating Source
entries.description: Where to get rating scores from.
entries.help: Choose which rating service to display: IMDB, TMDB, Rotten Tomatoes Audience, or Rotten Tomatoes Critics. Different sources may have different scores for the same movie.

entries.title: Rating Badge Position
entries.description: Where to place the rating badge.
entries.help: Choose which corner of the poster to display the rating badge: top-left, top-right, bottom-left, or bottom-right.

entries.title: Streaming Services
entries.description: Show where the movie is available to stream.
entries.help: Displays logos of streaming services where the movie is available (Netflix, Disney+, etc.). Data comes from TMDB's JustWatch integration. Requires TMDB to be configured.

entries.title: Streaming Services Position
entries.description: Where to show streaming service logos.
entries.help: Choose where streaming service logos appear on the display.

entries.title: Awards Badge
entries.help: Displays a badge for movies that won or were nominated for major awards like the Oscars. Adds prestige indicators to award-winning films.

entries.title: Show Trailer
entries.help: When enabled, movie trailers automatically play after the poster has been displayed for the configured delay time. Trailers are fetched from YouTube.

entries.title: Trailer Delay
entries.help: Controls how many seconds the poster is displayed before the trailer begins. A longer delay gives viewers time to read the movie info. Set to 0 for immediate playback. Default is 5 seconds.

entries.title: Trailer Muted
entries.help: When enabled, trailers play silently. Useful for displays in quiet environments or where audio would be disruptive.

entries.title: Loop Trailer
entries.help: When enabled, the trailer repeats until the next poster rotation. When disabled, the display returns to the poster after the trailer ends.

entries.title: QR Code Overlay
entries.description: Show a scannable QR code on the poster.
entries.help: Displays a QR code that links to a URL you specify. Viewers can scan it with their phone to get more info, buy tickets, or access any link you configure.
entries.example: Set the URL to your movie's IMDB page or a ticket booking site.

entries.title: QR Code Link Type
entries.description: What link the QR code should point to.
entries.help: Choose what the QR code links to when scanned: Trailer URL (opens the movie trailer on TMDB), IMDb URL (opens the IMDb page), TMDB URL (opens the TMDB page), or Custom (enter your own URL).

entries.title: Custom QR Code URL
entries.description: Custom URL for the QR code (when Link Type is set to Custom).
entries.help: Enter a custom URL that opens when someone scans the QR code. Must be a valid web address starting with http:// or https://. Only used when Link Type is set to 'Custom'.

entries.title: QR Code Position
entries.description: Where to display the QR code.
entries.help: Choose which corner of the screen to place the QR code overlay.

entries.title: QR Code Size
entries.help: Adjust how large the QR code appears on screen. Larger codes are easier to scan from a distance. Default is 100 pixels.

entries.title: Screensaver Mode
entries.help: Shows rotating media artwork with optional clock, metadata, and visual effects. Includes Ken Burns animation and various transition effects. Suitable for any screen orientation.

entries.title: Screen Orientation
entries.help: Choose how content is oriented. 'Auto' detects based on screen dimensions. Flipped variants rotate 180° for upside-down mounted screens.

entries.title: Show Poster
entries.help: Toggle whether the poster/artwork is shown. Disable if you only want metadata or other visual elements.

entries.title: Show Metadata
entries.help: Shows the title, year, and other metadata alongside the artwork.

entries.title: Show Clearlogo
entries.description: Display the movie's logo instead of text title.
entries.help: When available, shows the official movie/show logo graphic instead of plain text. Clearlogos are sourced from Fanart.tv and your media server.

entries.title: Show Rotten Tomatoes
entries.help: Shows the Rotten Tomatoes score with the appropriate Fresh/Rotten icon. Only displays for movies that meet your minimum score threshold.

entries.title: Minimum RT Score
entries.description: Only show RT rating above this score.
entries.help: Set the minimum Rotten Tomatoes score (0-10) required to display the rating. Movies below this threshold won't show the RT badge. Useful for only highlighting well-reviewed films.
entries.example: Set to 7 to only show ratings for 70%+ reviewed movies.

entries.title: Clock Widget
entries.help: Adds a clock to your screensaver. You can choose between 12-hour and 24-hour format, and select any timezone. The clock automatically adjusts for daylight saving time.

entries.title: Clock Timezone
entries.help: Choose which timezone the clock displays. 'Auto' uses your system's timezone. Select a specific timezone if the display is for a different location.

entries.title: Clock Format
entries.help: Choose between 12-hour (with AM/PM) or 24-hour time display.

entries.title: Content Scaling
entries.help: Adjust the size of the poster and metadata area. Values above 100% enlarge, below 100% shrink. Default is 100%.

entries.title: Clearlogo Scaling
entries.help: Adjust the size of clearlogo graphics. Increase if logos appear too small, decrease if they dominate the display.

entries.title: Clock Scaling
entries.help: Adjust the size of the clock widget. Increase for better visibility from across the room.

entries.title: Global Scaling
entries.help: Adjust the size of all interface elements at once. Useful for quickly adapting to different screen sizes or viewing distances.

entries.title: Device Sync
entries.help: When enabled, all devices in the same group show the same content at the same time. Creates a unified experience across multiple screens. This setting applies to all display modes.

entries.title: Sync Align Delay
entries.help: Sets the maximum time (in milliseconds) devices will wait to synchronize transitions. Higher values improve sync accuracy but may cause brief pauses. This setting applies to all display modes.

entries.title: Transition Effect
entries.help: Choose how artwork animates. 'Ken Burns' adds slow zoom and pan movement. 'Fade' smoothly dissolves between images. 'Slide' moves images in and out.

entries.title: Effect Pause Time
entries.help: How many seconds the image remains still after the transition animation completes. Adds a moment of calm before the next transition begins.

entries.title: Transition Interval
entries.help: Sets how many seconds each piece of content is displayed before transitioning to the next. Lower values create more dynamic displays, higher values are more relaxed.

entries.title: Wallart Mode
entries.help: Displays multiple pieces of artwork in a configurable grid layout. Perfect for landscape displays, video walls, or creating a gallery atmosphere. Supports movies, shows, and music artwork.

entries.title: Screen Orientation
entries.help: Choose how content is oriented. 'Auto' detects based on screen dimensions. Flipped variants rotate 180° for upside-down mounted screens.

entries.title: Refresh Rate
entries.help: Controls how frequently panels rotate to new artwork. Scale of 1-10 where higher values mean faster updates. Affects battery usage on portable devices.

entries.title: Randomness
entries.help: Controls the unpredictability of which panels update and when. Low values create more predictable patterns, high values create more chaotic, varied displays.

entries.title: Animation Type
entries.help: Choose the animation style when panels change content. Options include fade, slide, flip, and zoom effects.

entries.title: Density
entries.help: Controls the number of artwork panels shown on screen. Higher density shows more smaller panels, lower density shows fewer larger panels.

entries.title: Layout Variant
entries.help: Choose the grid layout pattern. Options include uniform grids, masonry layouts, and asymmetric arrangements with featured hero panels.

entries.title: Ambient Gradient
entries.help: Creates a subtle color gradient behind the panels based on the artwork colors. Adds atmosphere and visual cohesion.

entries.title: Bias Ambient to Hero
entries.description: Base gradient color on hero panel.
entries.help: When enabled, the ambient gradient color is primarily extracted from the hero panel rather than averaging all panels.

entries.title: Games Only Mode
entries.help: When enabled, Wallart shows only game covers from RomM, excluding movies, shows, and music. Requires RomM to be configured as a media source.

entries.title: Hero Panel Side
entries.description: Position of the large hero panel.
entries.help: When using a layout with a hero panel, choose whether it appears on the left or right side of the display.

entries.title: Hero Rotation Time
entries.description: How long before hero panel changes.
entries.help: Sets how many minutes the hero panel displays before rotating to new artwork. Hero panels typically rotate slower than regular panels for visual stability.

entries.title: Music Mode
entries.help: When enabled, Wallart displays album covers and artist images instead of movie posters. You can configure which metadata to show. Requires a music library in Plex or Jellyfin.

entries.title: Music Display Style
entries.help: Choose how album covers are displayed. Options include flat covers, vinyl record style, CD jewel case, and more.

entries.title: Music Animation
entries.help: Choose the animation style for album covers. Options include spinning vinyl, CD rotation, or static display.

entries.title: Music Grid Density
entries.help: Controls how many album covers are shown at once in music mode.

entries.title: Show Artist Name
entries.help: Shows the artist/band name below or on the album cover.

entries.title: Show Album Title
entries.help: Shows the album name below or on the cover.

entries.title: Show Release Year
entries.help: Shows when the album was released.

entries.title: Show Genre
entries.help: Shows the genre (Rock, Jazz, Electronic, etc.) for each album.

entries.title: Artist Rotation Time
entries.description: How long artist panels stay visible.
entries.help: Sets how many seconds an artist's content is displayed before rotating. Longer times let you appreciate each artist more.

entries.title: Album Rotation Time
entries.description: How long album covers stay visible.
entries.help: Sets how many seconds each album cover is displayed before rotating.

entries.title: Music Sort Mode
entries.help: Choose how albums and artists are ordered: by recently added, popularity, or randomly shuffled. You can also set weighted combinations.

entries.title: Plex
entries.description: Connect to your Plex Media Server.
entries.help: Pull artwork directly from your Plex library. Select which libraries to include (Movies, TV Shows, Music) and filter by year, genre, rating, or quality.
entries.example: Enter 'http://192.168.1.100:32400' as server URL and paste your Plex token.
entries.tip: Find your token: open any media in Plex Web → Get Info → View XML. The token is in the URL after 'X-Plex-Token='.

entries.title: Plex Movie Libraries
entries.description: Select which movie libraries to include.
entries.help: Choose which Plex movie libraries appear in your playlist. You can select multiple libraries. Only movies from selected libraries will be shown.

entries.title: Plex TV Show Libraries
entries.description: Select which TV show libraries to include.
entries.help: Choose which Plex TV show libraries appear in your playlist. Shows artwork will be pulled from selected libraries.

entries.title: Plex Music Libraries
entries.description: Select which music libraries to include.
entries.help: Choose which Plex music libraries to use for Music Mode. Album covers and artist images will be pulled from selected libraries.

entries.title: Plex Rating Filter
entries.help: Only show content with ratings at or above your selected threshold. Filters out lower-rated content from the playlist.

entries.title: Plex Genre Filter
entries.help: Only show content matching selected genres. Select multiple genres to include all matching content.
entries.example: Select 'Action' and 'Sci-Fi' to show only those genres.

entries.title: Plex Quality Filter
entries.help: Only show content matching selected quality levels. Useful for displaying only your highest quality content.

entries.title: Recently Added Only
entries.help: When enabled, only shows content added to Plex within the specified number of days. Great for highlighting new additions to your library.

entries.title: Jellyfin
entries.help: Pull artwork from your Jellyfin library. Enter your server address, port, and API key. Select which libraries to include and filter by year, genre, rating, or quality.
entries.example: Enter hostname '192.168.1.100', port '8096', and your API key.
entries.tip: Generate an API key in Jellyfin: Dashboard → API Keys → Add.

entries.title: Jellyfin Allow Insecure HTTPS
entries.help: Enable this if your Jellyfin server uses HTTPS with a self-signed or untrusted certificate. Required for local HTTPS setups without proper SSL certificates.

entries.title: Jellyfin Movie Libraries
entries.description: Select which movie libraries to include.
entries.help: Choose which Jellyfin movie libraries appear in your playlist.

entries.title: Jellyfin TV Show Libraries
entries.description: Select which TV show libraries to include.
entries.help: Choose which Jellyfin TV show libraries appear in your playlist.

entries.title: Jellyfin Filters
entries.help: Filter content by year, rating, genre, or video quality. Same filtering options as Plex.

entries.title: TMDB
entries.help: Access trending, popular, and upcoming movies from TMDB. Great for showcasing new releases even if they're not in your library. Requires a free TMDB API key.
entries.example: Get a free API key at themoviedb.org/settings/api

entries.title: TMDB Genre Filter
entries.help: Only show movies matching selected genres.

entries.title: RomM
entries.description: Connect to your RomM game library.
entries.help: Display game covers from your RomM (ROM Manager) server. Perfect for retro gaming displays. Enter your RomM server URL and credentials.

entries.title: Local Directory
entries.description: Display images from a local folder.
entries.help: Browse and select folders containing poster images on your server. Useful for custom artwork, promotional images, or content not in a media server. Supports JPG, PNG, and WebP files.

entries.title: Device Management
entries.help: Every screen running Posterrama automatically registers here. You can rename devices, assign them to groups, and configure individual settings. The grid shows real-time status of each device.
entries.example: Click a device card to open its settings. Rename it to 'Living Room TV' for easy identification.

entries.title: Device Groups
entries.help: Assign devices to groups so they display the same content at the same time. Perfect for video walls, hallway displays, or any setup where multiple screens should stay in sync.

entries.title: Dashboard
entries.help: The Dashboard shows your server status, connected devices, cache usage, and quick access to common actions like clearing the cache. It's your control center for monitoring Posterrama.

entries.title: Performance Metrics
entries.help: View real-time performance data: CPU usage, memory consumption, request rates, cache hit ratios, and response latency. Useful for troubleshooting slow performance or monitoring server health.

entries.title: Clear Cache
entries.help: Removes all cached poster images and metadata. Use this if you see outdated artwork, corrupted images, or want to force a fresh fetch from your media sources.
entries.tip: Clearing cache will temporarily slow down poster loading until images are re-cached.

entries.title: MQTT
entries.help: Connect to an MQTT broker for Home Assistant, Node-RED, or other automation integration. Remotely change modes, switch content, and monitor device status. Supports authentication.
entries.example: Enter broker address '192.168.1.50', port '1883', and credentials.
entries.tip: Enable 'Home Assistant Discovery' to auto-create entities in Home Assistant.

entries.title: Home Assistant Discovery
entries.help: When enabled, Posterrama devices automatically appear in Home Assistant as controllable entities. No manual YAML configuration needed.

entries.title: Backup & Restore
entries.help: Create backups of all settings, device configurations, and preferences. Use backups before major changes, when migrating servers, or for disaster recovery.
entries.tip: Create a backup before upgrading Posterrama to a new version.

entries.title: No posters showing
entries.description: Display is running but no posters appear.
entries.help: Check that at least one media source is enabled and shows 'Connected' status. Verify your filters aren't too restrictive (year, genre, rating). Check that selected libraries actually contain movies or shows.
entries.tip: If it worked before, try clearing the cache from Dashboard.

entries.title: Plex won't connect
entries.help: Verify the server URL includes the port (usually :32400). Check your Plex token hasn't expired - tokens become invalid after password changes. If using HTTPS with a self-signed certificate, enable 'Allow insecure HTTPS'. Ensure Plex is running and accessible from the Posterrama server.

entries.title: Jellyfin won't connect
entries.help: Verify hostname and port are correct (default port is 8096). Check your API key is valid. If using HTTPS with a self-signed certificate, enable 'Allow insecure HTTPS'. Ensure Jellyfin is running and the API key has proper permissions.

entries.title: Trailers not playing
entries.description: Trailer is enabled but videos don't play.
entries.help: Trailers are fetched from YouTube and require internet access on the display device. Not all movies have trailers available. If using a firewall or Pi-hole, ensure youtube.com and googlevideo.com aren't blocked.

entries.title: Posters loading slowly
entries.description: Posters take a long time to appear.
entries.help: First load is slower as images are cached. Check your network connection between Posterrama and your media server. Large libraries with many high-resolution posters take longer. Consider reducing the number of enabled libraries or using filters to limit content.

entries.title: Device shows offline
entries.description: A device appears offline in Device Management.
entries.help: Check the device has network connectivity and can reach the Posterrama server. Verify the device's browser or app is still running. Try refreshing the display URL. Check for firewall rules blocking WebSocket connections.

entries.title: Wrong or outdated artwork
entries.description: Posters show incorrect or old images.
entries.help: Clear the cache from Dashboard to force fresh downloads. If the issue persists, check your media server - the artwork source may have incorrect images. For Plex/Jellyfin, try refreshing metadata on the affected items.

entries.title: MQTT not connecting
entries.help: Verify broker address and port are correct (common ports: 1883 for unencrypted, 8883 for TLS). Check username and password if authentication is required. Ensure the broker is running and accessible. Check firewall isn't blocking the connection.

entries.title: Hostname is required
entries.description: You see 'Hostname is required to fetch libraries'.
entries.help: Before you can load libraries, you need to enter the server address first. Fill in the hostname or IP address of your Plex or Jellyfin server, then click Test Connection.

entries.title: Invalid Port error
entries.description: You see 'Port must be between 1024 and 65535'.
entries.help: The port number must be a valid number between 1024 and 65535. Common ports: Plex uses 32400, Jellyfin uses 8096. Check your media server's settings for the correct port.

entries.title: Save failed error
entries.description: You see 'Save failed' when trying to save settings.
entries.help: The settings couldn't be saved. Check your network connection. If the issue persists, check the server logs in the Logs tab for more details. You can also try refreshing the page and trying again.

entries.title: File Too Large error
entries.description: You see 'File size must be less than 2 MB'.
entries.help: The image you're trying to upload is too large. Reduce the file size by compressing the image or using a smaller resolution. Most tools like Preview (Mac) or Paint (Windows) can resize images.

entries.title: No device selected
entries.description: You see 'Please select a device' or 'No device selected'.
entries.help: You need to select one or more devices before you can send commands to them. Click on a device card in Device Management to select it. Selected devices show a highlighted border.

entries.title: Connection failed
entries.help: Check that the hostname/IP is correct and the server is running. Verify the port number matches your server's configuration. If using HTTPS with a self-signed certificate, enable 'Allow insecure HTTPS'. Make sure Posterrama can reach the server (not blocked by firewall).

entries.title: Device did not respond
entries.description: You see 'Device did not ack in time'.
entries.help: The device received the command but didn't confirm it in time. The device might be busy, have a slow connection, or the browser tab might be in the background. Try sending the command again or check if the device is still online.

entries.title: Server restarting message
entries.description: You see 'Posterrama is restarting' or 'Still restarting'.
entries.help: After saving certain settings (like media source configuration), the server needs to restart. This usually takes a few seconds. The page will automatically refresh when the server is back online. If it takes more than 30 seconds, try refreshing manually.

entries.title: Click again to confirm
entries.description: You see 'Click again to confirm' after clicking Clear Cache.
entries.help: This is a safety feature. Clearing the cache will delete all cached poster images. Click the button again to confirm, or wait a few seconds to cancel. The cache will be rebuilt automatically but first-time image loading will be slower.

entries.title: Invalid JSON error
entries.description: You see 'Invalid JSON' when editing settings.
entries.help: The data you entered isn't valid JSON format. Check for missing commas, unmatched brackets, or extra quotation marks. If you're not sure, try using a JSON validator tool online to find the error.

entries.title: Brightness
entries.help: Increase or decrease the brightness of the entire display. Useful for adapting to room lighting conditions. Default is 100% (no change).

entries.title: Contrast
entries.help: Higher contrast makes colors more vivid and blacks deeper. Lower contrast creates a softer look. Default is 100% (no change).

entries.title: Color Filter
entries.description: Apply a color filter to the display.
entries.help: Add a color tint or effect to the entire display. Options include sepia (warm vintage), grayscale (black & white), warm, cool, or custom tint colors.

entries.title: Quick Theme
entries.help: Apply a preset that configures poster style, background, global effects, and typography all at once. Choose from 12 curated looks like Classic Cinema, Noir, Neon Nights, and more.

entries.title: Global Font Family
entries.description: Set the font for both header and footer.
entries.help: Master control for typography. When changed, this font is applied to both the header and footer. You can still customize them individually afterwards.

entries.title: Global Text Color Mode
entries.description: Choose custom color or automatic ton-sur-ton.
entries.help: Custom lets you pick a specific text color. Ton-sur-ton automatically calculates an elegant color based on the poster's dominant colors.

entries.title: Global Text Effect
entries.description: Apply shadow or glow effect to all text.
entries.help: Master control for text effects. Options include subtle shadow, dramatic shadow, neon glow, and soft glow. Applied to both header and footer.

entries.title: Now Playing Priority
entries.description: How Now Playing interrupts the slideshow.
entries.help: Controls whether currently playing content takes priority over the regular poster rotation. When enabled, the display shows what's actively playing on your media server.

entries.title: Now Playing User Filter
entries.help: Only show Now Playing for specific users. Leave empty to show for all users. Useful in multi-user households where you only want to see your own activity.

entries.title: Now Playing Check Interval
entries.description: How often to check for active playback.
entries.help: Time in seconds between checks for currently playing content. Lower values = faster detection but more server requests. Default is 10 seconds.

entries.title: Trailer Settings
entries.help: Expand this panel to configure trailer behavior: enable/disable, volume, auto-play timing, and more. Trailers are fetched from YouTube when available.

entries.title: QR Code Settings
entries.help: Expand this panel to configure QR code behavior: position, size, what link to show (TMDB, IMDB, trailer, etc.).

entries.title: Rating Settings
entries.help: Expand this panel to configure which ratings to show (IMDB, TMDB, Rotten Tomatoes), their position, and minimum score thresholds.

entries.title: Watch Provider Settings
entries.help: Expand this panel to configure which streaming services to show (Netflix, Disney+, etc.) and how they appear on the poster.

entries.title: Enable Plex
entries.description: Turn Plex integration on or off.
entries.help: Enable to use Plex as a media source. You'll need your Plex server address and authentication token.

entries.title: Plex Server Address
entries.description: Your Plex server hostname or IP.
entries.help: Enter the hostname or IP address of your Plex server. Can be a local IP (192.168.x.x), hostname (plex.local), or domain name.

entries.title: Plex Port
entries.help: The port your Plex server runs on. Default is 32400. Only change if you've configured Plex to use a different port.

entries.title: Plex Token
entries.help: Required to access your Plex server. Find it in Plex Web: open any media item, click (...) > Get Info > View XML, and look for 'X-Plex-Token' in the URL.
entries.tip: Keep this secret - it provides full access to your Plex server.

entries.title: Plex Movie Libraries
entries.description: Select which movie libraries to use.
entries.help: Choose one or more movie libraries from your Plex server. Only selected libraries will be included in the display.

entries.title: Plex TV Show Libraries
entries.description: Select which TV show libraries to use.
entries.help: Choose one or more TV show libraries from your Plex server. Shows are displayed using their season/series artwork.

entries.title: Plex Music Libraries
entries.description: Select which music libraries to use.
entries.help: Choose music libraries to display album artwork. Works great with Wallart Music Mode.

entries.title: Plex Recent Days
entries.help: Limit to items added within this many days. Set to 0 to include all content regardless of when it was added.

entries.title: Plex Year Filter
entries.help: Only show content released within a specific year range. Useful for focusing on newer releases or classic films.

entries.title: Enable Jellyfin
entries.description: Turn Jellyfin integration on or off.
entries.help: Enable to use Jellyfin as a media source. You'll need your Jellyfin server address and API key.

entries.title: Jellyfin Server Address
entries.description: Your Jellyfin server hostname or IP.
entries.help: Enter the hostname or IP address of your Jellyfin server. Can be a local IP, hostname, or domain name.

entries.title: Jellyfin Port
entries.help: The port your Jellyfin server runs on. Default is 8096 for HTTP, 8920 for HTTPS.

entries.title: Jellyfin API Key
entries.help: Required to access your Jellyfin server. Create one in Jellyfin Dashboard > API Keys > Add.
entries.tip: Keep this secret - it provides access to your Jellyfin server.

entries.title: Jellyfin Allow Insecure HTTPS
entries.help: Enable if your Jellyfin server uses HTTPS with a self-signed certificate. Not needed for HTTP connections or valid SSL certs.

entries.title: Jellyfin Movie Libraries
entries.description: Select which movie libraries to use.
entries.help: Choose one or more movie libraries from your Jellyfin server.

entries.title: Jellyfin TV Show Libraries
entries.description: Select which TV show libraries to use.
entries.help: Choose one or more TV show libraries from your Jellyfin server.

entries.title: Jellyfin Recent Days
entries.help: Limit to items added within this many days. Set to 0 to include all content.

entries.title: Jellyfin Year Filter
entries.help: Only show content released within a specific year range.

entries.title: Enable TMDB
entries.description: Turn TMDB integration on or off.
entries.help: Enable to fetch trending movies, upcoming releases, or specific categories from The Movie Database.

entries.title: TMDB API Key
entries.help: Required to fetch data from TMDB. Get a free API key at themoviedb.org/settings/api.

entries.title: TMDB Category
entries.help: Choose what type of content to fetch: Trending (currently popular), Upcoming (future releases), Now Playing, Top Rated, or Popular.

entries.title: TMDB Minimum Rating
entries.help: Only show movies with at least this rating (0-10). Set to 0 to include all ratings.

entries.title: TMDB Year Filter
entries.help: Only show content released within a specific year range.

entries.title: Enable RomM
entries.description: Turn RomM integration on or off.
entries.help: Enable to display game cover art from your RomM server. Great for retro gaming setups.

entries.title: RomM Server URL
entries.help: Full URL to your RomM server including protocol (http:// or https://).

entries.title: RomM Username
entries.help: Your RomM account username for authentication.

entries.title: RomM Password
entries.help: Your RomM account password for authentication.

entries.title: RomM Allow Insecure HTTPS
entries.help: Enable if your RomM server uses HTTPS with a self-signed certificate.

entries.title: RomM Platforms
entries.description: Select which gaming platforms to include.
entries.help: Choose which gaming systems to show. Leave empty to include all platforms.

entries.title: Enable Local Directory
entries.description: Turn Local Directory on or off.
entries.help: Enable to use poster images from a local folder on the server. Great for custom artwork or posters not in your media library.

entries.title: Enable Streaming Sources
entries.description: Turn streaming sources on or off.
entries.help: Enable to show content available on streaming services like Netflix, Disney+, Amazon Prime, etc. Content is fetched from TMDB's streaming data.

entries.title: Streaming Minimum Rating
entries.help: Only show streaming content with at least this TMDB rating (0-10).

entries.title: Streaming New Releases Only
entries.help: When enabled, only shows content recently added to streaming services instead of their full catalog.

entries.title: Streaming Region
entries.help: Select your country to show content available in your region. Streaming catalogs vary by country.

entries.title: Enable MQTT
entries.description: Turn MQTT integration on or off.
entries.help: Enable to connect Posterrama to an MQTT broker for home automation integration. Works with Home Assistant, Node-RED, and other MQTT clients.

entries.title: MQTT Broker Address
entries.help: Address of your MQTT broker. For Home Assistant, this is usually your HA server address.

entries.title: MQTT Port
entries.help: Port of your MQTT broker. Default is 1883 for unencrypted, 8883 for TLS/SSL.

entries.title: MQTT Username
entries.help: Username for MQTT broker authentication. Leave empty if your broker doesn't require auth.

entries.title: MQTT Password
entries.help: Password for MQTT broker authentication. Leave empty if your broker doesn't require auth.

entries.title: Film Cards - Card Rotation
entries.help: Time in seconds before the card group changes to show different content. This rotates the entire card collection.

entries.title: Film Cards - Poster Rotation
entries.help: Time in seconds before individual posters within a card rotate to show the next item.

entries.title: Film Cards - Group By
entries.description: How to group content on cards.
entries.help: Choose how content is organized on cards: by genre, year, or other criteria.

entries.title: Film Cards - Minimum Group Size
entries.help: Groups with fewer items than this won't be shown. Prevents showing nearly empty groups.

entries.title: Parallax - Layer Count
entries.help: How many depth layers to use for the parallax effect. More layers = more depth but higher performance cost.

entries.title: Parallax - Depth Scale
entries.help: How pronounced the depth/distance effect is between layers. Higher = more dramatic parallax.

entries.title: Parallax - Perspective
entries.help: Controls the 3D perspective effect. Higher values create a more dramatic vanishing point effect.

entries.title: Parallax - Speed
entries.help: How fast the parallax scrolling animation moves. Lower = slower and more subtle.

entries.title: Parallax - Smooth Scroll
entries.help: When enabled, scrolling has a smooth easing effect instead of linear movement.

entries.title: Music Mode - Recent Weight
entries.help: How much to prioritize recently added albums in the display. Higher = more recent albums shown.

entries.title: Music Mode - Popular Weight
entries.help: How much to prioritize frequently played/popular albums. Higher = more popular albums shown.

entries.title: Music Mode - Random Weight
entries.help: How much randomness to add to album selection. Higher = more variety, lower = more predictable ordering.

entries.title: Cinema Mode
entries.help: Cinema mode shows one poster at a time in a cinematic, full-screen layout. Perfect for a home theater lobby or media room. Features rich metadata, trailers, ratings, and promotional content.

entries.title: Streaming Providers
entries.description: Select which streaming services to include.
entries.help: Choose which streaming platforms to fetch content from. Only content available on selected services will be shown.

entries.title: Environment Variables
entries.help:
Environment variables can be set in a .env file in the root directory or passed directly to the server. They override config.json settings.

**Server:**
• SERVER_PORT (default: 4000) - Server port
• NODE_ENV (development/production/test)
• DEBUG (true/false) - Enable debug mode

**Authentication:**
• SESSION_SECRET (required) - Cookie signing secret
• ADMIN_USERNAME - Admin login username
• ADMIN_PASSWORD_HASH - Bcrypt hashed password
• ADMIN_2FA_SECRET - TOTP secret for 2FA
• API_ACCESS_TOKEN - Token for API access

**Plex:**
• PLEX_HOSTNAME - Plex server hostname/IP
• PLEX_PORT (default: 32400) - Plex server port
• PLEX_TOKEN - Plex authentication token

**Jellyfin:**
• JELLYFIN_HOSTNAME - Jellyfin server hostname/IP
• JELLYFIN_PORT (default: 8096) - Jellyfin server port
• JELLYFIN_TOKEN - Jellyfin API key
• JELLYFIN_INSECURE_HTTPS (true/false) - Allow self-signed certs

**RomM:**
• ROMM_HOSTNAME - RomM server hostname/IP
• ROMM_PORT (default: 8080) - RomM server port
• ROMM_USERNAME / ROMM_PASSWORD - RomM credentials

**Logging:**
• LOG_LEVEL (error/warn/info/debug) - Logging verbosity
• DEBUG_JELLYFIN / DEBUG_ROMM - Source-specific debugging
• JELLYFIN_HTTP_DEBUG / ROMM_HTTP_DEBUG - HTTP client debugging
entries.example:
Create a .env file: SESSION_SECRET="your-secret-here"
SERVER_PORT=4000
LOG_LEVEL=info

entries.title: API Documentation
entries.help: Posterrama provides a comprehensive REST API for automation and integration. The interactive Swagger/OpenAPI documentation is available at /api-docs on your server. It lists all available endpoints, request/response formats, and allows you to test API calls directly.
